analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:
“Monks, dwell contemplating the unattractive in the body,

original: ānāpānassati ca vo ajjhattaṁ parimukhaṁ sūpaṭṭhitā hotu;
analyzed: āna apāna sati ca vaḥ ajjhattam parimukham su upaṭṭhitā hotu
translated: and establish mindfulness in the body to the extent necessary for knowledge and mindfulness.

original: sabbasaṅkhāresu aniccānupassino viharatha.🔽Asubhānupassīnaṁ, bhikkhave, kāyasmiṁ viharataṁ yo subhāya dhātuyā rāgānusayo so pahīyati.
analyzed: sabba saṅkhāresu anicca anupassinaḥ viharatha  bhikkhave kāyasmiṃ viharatam yaḥ subhāya dhātuyā rāga anusayo so pahīyati
translated: And dwell contemplating impermanence in all conditioned phenomena.🔽For those who dwell contemplating the unattractive in the body, any underlying tendency to lust for the attractive will be abandoned.

original: Ānāpānassatiyā ajjhattaṁ parimukhaṁ sūpaṭṭhititāya ye bāhirā vitakkāsayā vighātapakkhikā, te na honti.
analyzed: āna apāna satiyāḥ ajjhattam parimukham su upaṭṭhiti tāya ye bāhirāḥ vitakka āsayāḥ vighāta pakkhikā te na honti
translated: For those who establish mindfulness in the body to the extent necessary for knowledge and mindfulness, any underlying tendency to aversion towards the repulsive will be abandoned.

original: Sabbasaṅkhāresu aniccānupassīnaṁ viharataṁ yā avijjā sā pahīyati, yā vijjā sā uppajjatī”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: sabba saṅkhāresu anicca anupassīnam viharatam yā avijjā sā pahīyati yā vijjā sā uppajjati iti  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: For those who dwell contemplating impermanence in all conditioned phenomena, any underlying tendency to ignorance will be abandoned, and any underlying tendency to wisdom will arise.”🔽The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:

analyzed: asubha anupassī  āna apāne paṭissato  sabba saṅkhāra samatha
translated: “Contemplating the unattractive in the body,🔽mindful, with breathing in and out,🔽seeing the stilling of all processes,
That monk is truly a seer,
and is liberated in that place,

original: sa ve yogātigo munī”ti.🔽Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: sa veḥ yoga atigaḥ muni iti  ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: he is a sage who has gone beyond bonds.”🔽This is the meaning of what the Buddha says in the Udāna.
